intro: Barkhausia heterocarpa, commonly known as the yellow bark lily, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers and fibrous, aromatic bark. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are strap-shaped and evergreen, while its flowers bloom in spring. The bark is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
